item.prompt: Write a letter about a game that you like to play. Make sure to tell how the game uses numbers or counting, or teaches you to keep score.
Imagine that you are your favorite wild animal. Write a story telling where you live, what you do, and what makes you special.
Read a fable or two from another country or culture. Then write a fable that has the same kind of characters, plot, and setting.
Write a descriptive paper about your favorite place in the United States. Use your five senses to describe what you see, hear, taste, touch, and smell.
Write a compare-and-contrast paper about rain and snow. How are they alike? How are they different?
Write a descriptive sketch about your favorite music. Tell why it is your favorite and what it is like.
Write a factual report about a mathematician and what he or she discovered.
Conduct an experiment. Write a how-to paper telling how you did it and what happened.
Write a personal essay telling about your community. Tell about how your family came to live there and how the community has changed over the years.

Write an opinion letter that tries to convince a friend to read a book you like. Be sure to tell why the book is something that your friend would like, too. Does the book discuss your friendâ€™s hobby or interest?
Write an opinion speech about how your classmates can help protect an endangered animal. Do research to find facts that support your opinion.
Write an opinion paper about a mystery that happened in the past. Use facts to support your reasons. You might just help solve the mystery!
